meanings.definition: A period of time in history or a person's life, typically marked by notable events or characteristics.
meanings.sent1: During the epoch of the dinosaurs, giant creatures roamed the earth.
meanings.sent2: The Renaissance was an epoch of great artistic and cultural achievements.
meanings.sent3: In the epoch of my childhood, I believed in magic and fairy tales.
meanings.sent4: Her graduation marked the end of an epoch in her academic journey.
meanings.sent5: The fall of the Berlin Wall symbolized the end of an epoch of division.

meanings.definition: A particular period of time in history or a person's life.
meanings.sent1: The Victorian epoch was known for its strict social norms.
meanings.sent2: The roaring twenties was an epoch of economic prosperity and cultural change.
meanings.sent3: During my teenage epoch, I thought I knew everything.
meanings.sent4: The pandemic brought an unexpected epoch of remote work and virtual meetings.
meanings.sent5: The epoch of the Industrial Revolution transformed societies and economies.
